title: War in Ukraine shifts priorities among European government agencies
summary: The war in Ukraine has prompted European civil and military space to revise budgets, programs, and policies to fortify launch capabilities and meet emerging needs.

title: Maryland Students, Navy Pilots to Hear from NASA Astronauts in Space
summary: Pilots from the U.S. Naval Test Pilot School in Patuxent River, Maryland, and students across southern Maryland will have an opportunity this week to hear from NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

title: Rocket Factory Augsburg talks reusability plans and 3D printing
summary: In a recent interview with NASASpaceflight, Rocket Factory Augsburg (RFA) co-founder and COO Dr. Stefan Brieschenk talked about current manufacturing methods and upcoming plans for its RFA One rocket.

title: Apex raises seed round to mass produce smallsats
summary: A startup that envisions manufacturing large numbers of small satellites has raised a seed round of funding.

title: Preligens aims to become a long-term DoD supplier
summary: Preligens is expanding its U.S. subsidiary in a bid to become a long-term supplier of geospatial data analysis software to the U.S. Department of Defense.
